description: From Middle English fully, fulliche, volliche, from Old English fullīċe (“fully”), equivalent to full +‎ -ly. Compare German völlig (“fully”), Swedish fullt (“fully”).

adverbs.description: fully (comparative more fully, superlative most fully)

entries.meaning: In a full manner; without lack or defect.
In a full degree; to a full extent.
examples: He is fully capable of meeting his responsibilities.
it was fully four hours before we arrived home.
